definition: tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
honest and unaffected but not talkative (idiom)

sentences.english: What foreigners denounce as cluelessness Germans see as cool-headedness.
sentences.chinese: 外國人的公開指責的和木訥德國人的所見一樣冷靜。
那個木訥的男人走了進來。

sentences.english: I'm clueless when it comes to women. I have no idea what they want.
sentences.chinese: 一談到女人我就有些木訥，我不瞭解她們想要什麼。

sentences.english: Muna , depression, only seems to breathe life, no vitality.
sentences.chinese: 木訥了，抑鬱了，生命好像只有呼吸，沒有活力。

sentences.english: Judy is so reserved that it is hard to understand her.
sentences.chinese: 朱迪非常內向而木訥，因而很難使人瞭解她。

sentences.english: She could barely believe that such a dumb man as he was would be so considerate and thoughtful.
sentences.chinese: 那麼木訥的一個人，竟有這樣溫柔細密的心事。

sentences.english: I’m clueless when it comes to women. I have no idea what they want.
sentences.chinese: 一談到女人我就有些木訥，我不瞭解她們想要什麼。

sentences.english: I also find myself either agitated or slowed down.
sentences.chinese: 我發現自己有時躁動不安，有時木訥遲鈍。

sentences.english: Do not like is not sad, dull eyes, complex emotions.
sentences.chinese: 不悲不喜，木訥的雙眼，複雜的情緒。

sentences.english: My friend and his wife stood up and walked numbly past their family.
sentences.chinese: 朋友和他的妻子站起來，木訥地走過家人。

sentences.english: I also like your stiff Japanese Bushido, as well as karate.
sentences.chinese: 我也喜歡你木訥日本的武士道，還有空手道。

definition: full of political wisdom (idiom)/politically astute/with encyclopedic experience of state policy
to take care of one's family
to make a clear difference between what one likes and what one hates/to have well-defined likes and dislikes
to be loyal (to one's friends)/to value loyalty
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
